channel.title: Server Advertisement Rules
channel.description:
It has come to my attention that Constructive Criticism isn't allowed when it's being used in the context of "corrective" I truly do believe and feel like the staff need to review and discuss the server advertisement rules once more. (if they even did in the first place...surely Flame_ had to get the rules approved by a higher member) Here are a couple of suggestions if the rules do NOT change: -Make it so advertisements are "locked" from having replies. If the community can't express what we are seeing then there is no point whatsoever in posting replies in general. That's like reading reviews on one of these sites like OfficeMax or BestBuy. Only the "nice" reviews are technically posted(they have to be pre-approved). -Stricter rules for posting an advertisement. Generally you have a topic where a person will post a bunch of walls of text and say JOIN NOW OMGZ. Yeah...uh... as the old saying goes
no pics no clicks
If an owner is too lazy to make a couple of media images for proof/to show the revision/etc then they honestly have no reason in advertising in the first place. What is an advertisement?
A notice, such as a poster or a paid announcement in the print, broadcast, or [u][b]electronic media[/b][/u], designed to attract public attention or patronage.
-Finally, I would like to suggest pre-approved topics. I'm sure some of you will be like "omg work load of mods dude!" Yeah uh...no offence to Flame_ but I'm sure he can handle it. I've seen his dedication. We may get what one or two REAL new advertisements in a day? Shouldn't be too hard. This idea is to help stop spammers in general in the advertisement section from posting his server more than once. Sure it gets locked eventually but a lot of "server browsers" don't realize this as they are searching for a server not looking out for the forums. Due to this some servers will have the "unfair advantage". For reference of original discrepancy: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,640022.msg4348685.html#msg4348685

item.title: Server Advertisement Rules
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

I know taking a server and renaming it and then calling it their own with zero effort really sucks for those that work really hard the servers. They are making undeserved profit but however servers don’t generally make more profit than what they are actually spending. Hosting at home require electricity bill which generally costed me 30$ on the computer usage alone. Yes you can get vps and price varies but they generally won’t get any significant traffic or return without effort, it shows. Most people quit shitty servers in less than a month however well developed and unique ones stay for a long time.
Life sucks. the good die young and the evil one gets away with murder. You can’t cure the effortless. It’s like smoking, there will always be others that don’t put effort in their threads… What can you do about it? They just don’t change.
Well if this suggestion succeeds in changing the community’s mind then I am fine with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisement Rules
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:23, topic:527897”]

1178ktj.png1016×234

I though it would be a good idea to bring this up because it’s clear the staff know some of the rules are unnecessary or need redoing. They will work doing all everything they can in time, could you just give them the time they need/want instead of trying to pressure them into doing it.

/thread?[/quote]give them time? That’s three months back good lord… surely they still aren’t discussing rules

This brings back fond memories of the whole "order of the phoenix doesn’t do anything except have meetings " fanfics

Alas, I just wish the staff would actually keep us the community updated on changes that are being discussed as we have no idea really what is and what is not on the table.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisement Rules
item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

Davidi2:

I don’t care if I change your mind, it’s for the topic.

There’s no shame in having a shift of opinions… unless you’re an atheist on your deathbed and convert. That could upset some people.

my attempt at levity

I was going to write out a long reply, but then I realized that I was just rehashing what everyone already knows. So I’ll just say this.

[b]If you’re going to critique and point out flaws in an Advertisement or Server Release, it should be done in a polite, detailed and explanatory manner.

Would it not be better for the entire community to offer their feedback and advice to the newbie Advertiser than chase them away? I THINK SO.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisement Rules
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:19, topic:527897”]You are jumping to an incorrect conclusion.
First of all, what constructive criticism is will always come down to the discretion of the moderator that is watching the topic and its replies. If someone posts ‘good job, but i don’t like how this source is used time and time again,’ then I can give you my words that I will delete such a reply, as it is not giving any feedback on the server in any way, and it is none of your business on what source the server owner decides to use for their game.
Having posts require approval is too time-consuming and could be better spent doing other more beneficial things to the forum.
As for the ‘no pics no clicks,’ if I see such a reply I will delete it. It is not our place to require an advertiser to include media in any form on their thread. If they wish to spend what seems to you to be 5 minutes on an advertisement thread, then simply skip over it should you not like it.
It is not my place to reject advertisements simply because they do not have any media. Also, it is a lot of work simply because I’m not online 24/7, and other moderators do not spend all of their online time within this section.
If a person decides to post multiple advertisements they will receive a post-ban, basically meaning that they cannot post in that section until I lift the punishment. Also, there are quite a few people that spend time watching out for the section rather than looking for servers to play.

Long story short, if you see something that you feel is breaking any rules, report it. If your reports are not presenting any real reason as to why it should be taken care of, I’ll send you a private message letting you know.[/quote]Very neutral argument Flame_

I just ask that the community stays updated on the discussion if there will be any change to this. That is one key issue that at least I hav epersonally seen is that there is no communication between the staff and the community. How are we supposed to know if a suggestion has been declined, still pending, needs more suggestions, is still open, and etc if a staff administrator does not keep us updated. Obviously a lock would indicate either accepted/declined but I am talking about the mid way points.

Anyway it’s a touchy subject in general about advertisements and what should and should not be allowed. I just hope the staff takes all sides into consideration when discussing it.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisement Rules
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

You are jumping to an incorrect conclusion.
First of all, what constructive criticism is will always come down to the discretion of the moderator that is watching the topic and its replies. If someone posts ‘good job, but i don’t like how this source is used time and time again,’ then I can give you my words that I will delete such a reply, as it is not giving any feedback on the server in any way, and it is none of your business on what source the server owner decides to use for their game.
Having posts require approval is too time-consuming and could be better spent doing other more beneficial things to the forum.
As for the ‘no pics no clicks,’ if I see such a reply I will delete it. It is not our place to require an advertiser to include media in any form on their thread. If they wish to spend what seems to you to be 5 minutes on an advertisement thread, then simply skip over it should you not like it.
It is not my place to reject advertisements simply because they do not have any media. Also, it is a lot of work simply because I’m not online 24/7, and other moderators do not spend all of their online time within this section.
If a person decides to post multiple advertisements they will receive a post-ban, basically meaning that they cannot post in that section until I lift the punishment. Also, there are quite a few people that spend time watching out for the section rather than looking for servers to play.

Long story short, if you see something that you feel is breaking any rules, report it. If your reports are not presenting any real reason as to why it should be taken care of, I’ll send you a private message letting you know.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisement Rules
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Teem_Rocket, post:17, topic:527897”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=646649.msg4348894#msg4348894 date=1376339591]

[quote author=Teem_Rocket link=topic=646649.msg4348869#msg4348869 date=1376338931]

Do you have a better idea for an attempt to stop users from simply downloading and hosting as-is? This isn’t the place to start up by the way. Let’s take this to Private Messages.
[/quote]No, I just think the idea of not letting people download and host as-is is stupid. That’s how I got into RSPS.

The thread doesn’t specifically say you can’t download a base as-is and host it. It’s just a thread suggesting that they should put time and effort into their source, and the more important aspects such as stability.

I’m not trying to degrade users who host as-is. I just think that the users who have a general idea of what to do, should try putting time into their project before hosting and or releasing.
[/quote]If they want to bother that’s great. I just think it’s stupid to have a topic saying that they should do that when doing it the other way is probably better for new people getting into RSPS.

It’s just there for them to read before they decide to host and advertise a base with absolutely 0 edits or modifications and wonder why they’re getting flamed by some people. We should have taken this discussion to P.M. :|[/quote]The people that flame are the morons, not the hosters. Make a topic for the flamers explaining that new people are bound to just want to host a source that is easy to use. And why? If it’s in PM it’s useless. I don’t care if I change your mind, it’s for the topic.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisement Rules
item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

Personally, I try to use this layout when posting in a Server Advertisement Thread that I don’t like and wish to offer critique.

I personally don't like the sprite recolors.

I do like that you acknowledge that you’ve not made very many modifications to the Base. <3 you for being honest.

I offer critique and then I try to find something they’ve done right or which suits my personal taste.

On-Topic: I do think that there should be some sort of system in place to help filter Server Advertisements. A majority of these Threads are straight up leeched and hosted. Some Threads themselves are even ripped and reposted in an attempt to pass it off as an original creation. It might cut out some site traffic, but would be worth it in my opinion and would better the community. It would also tone down a lot of the flaming and such.

EDIT: I still say this should be a required read

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisement Rules
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:4, topic:527897”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=646649.msg4348698#msg4348698 date=1376322401]
Next time, make it less blatant when you create a thread to passively attack me.

As for your issue, I don’t see a problem with my decisions. What you saw as constructive criticism, I saw as spam. You continued posting about the graphical bugs after the advertiser stated that he liked his server the way it was.

I agree that you should be allowed to point out parts of the server that you would like to see improved, but in all honesty, when someone is advertising their server and states that the change will not be made, I think other members should let it be. To me, it’s more an issue of when to stop posting this so-called constructive criticism. In the end, if you’re not an active player on the server, it won’t affect you. The owner of the server may end up receiving fewer new players because of it, but that only affects him or her.

TL;DR
Constructive criticism becomes spam after a certain point. I’m sure you can agree with me on that.
[/quote]
Sadly I don’t agree with you. CC is and shall always be a useful tool to a real developer. Any CC no matter if a real player or not should be taken, observed, and worked from. Especially when it comes to something such as a graphical issue. It isn’t that hard to go and replace a silly little graphic in a game. All he had to do was make a topic and we could had assisted him further. Again, negligence on his part is his fault not the community.[/quote]

He stated that he didn’t want to change anything, so why should you pressure him to? If I asked you to change your lifestyle and you didn’t want to, would you seek assistance in doing so? Just because you think something is “wrong”, it doesn’t mean the other person has to change according to what you think.

This will be discussed and a change to the rules will be made if needed.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisement Rules
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:3, topic:527897”]Next time, make it less blatant when you create a thread to passively attack me.

As for your issue, I don’t see a problem with my decisions. What you saw as constructive criticism, I saw as spam. You continued posting about the graphical bugs after the advertiser stated that he liked his server the way it was.

I agree that you should be allowed to point out parts of the server that you would like to see improved, but in all honesty, when someone is advertising their server and states that the change will not be made, I think other members should let it be. To me, it’s more an issue of when to stop posting this so-called constructive criticism. In the end, if you’re not an active player on the server, it won’t affect you. The owner of the server may end up receiving fewer new players because of it, but that only affects him or her.

TL;DR
Constructive criticism becomes spam after a certain point. I’m sure you can agree with me on that.[/quote]
Not attacking you, attacking the rules. You are doing your job I get that.(even though technically the rules says the other part… )

If you noticed I kept trying to tell the user as well. “You may see it like this, but your players won’t” Server negligence is on the owner/developer(s) not on the community.

Sadly I don’t agree with you. CC is and shall always be a useful tool to a real developer. Any CC no matter if a real player or not should be taken, observed, and worked from. Especially when it comes to something such as a graphical issue. It isn’t that hard to go and replace a silly little graphic in a game. All he had to do was make a topic and we could had assisted him further. Again, negligence on his part is his fault not the community.

If you was a new owner would you tell those and I am going to use your words now “condescending” CC from experienced server owners to fudge off instead of embracing what they are telling you? Of course you wouldn’t.

TL;DR

[size=12pt]Even if you and I don’t agree on this issue at hand this is a suggestion and I would appreciate it if the staff still discussed the rules/suggestions that were set forth in this topic. [/size]

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisement Rules
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

It has come to my attention that Constructive Criticism isn’t allowed when it’s being used in the context of “corrective”

I truly do believe and feel like the staff need to review and discuss the server advertisement rules once more. (if they even did in the first place…surely Flame_ had to get the rules approved by a higher member)

Here are a couple of suggestions if the rules do NOT change:

-Make it so advertisements are “locked” from having replies. If the community can’t express what we are seeing then there is no point whatsoever in posting replies in general. That’s like reading reviews on one of these sites like OfficeMax or BestBuy. Only the “nice” reviews are technically posted(they have to be pre-approved).

-Stricter rules for posting an advertisement. Generally you have a topic where a person will post a bunch of walls of text and say JOIN NOW OMGZ. Yeah…uh… as the old saying goes

no pics no clicks

If an owner is too lazy to make a couple of media images for proof/to show the revision/etc then they honestly have no reason in advertising in the first place.

What is an advertisement?

A notice, such as a poster or a paid announcement in the print, broadcast, or [u][b]electronic media[/b][/u], designed to attract public attention or patronage.

-Finally, I would like to suggest pre-approved topics. I’m sure some of you will be like “omg work load of mods dude!” Yeah uh…no offence to Flame_ but I’m sure he can handle it. I’ve seen his dedication. We may get what one or two REAL new advertisements in a day? Shouldn’t be too hard.

This idea is to help stop spammers in general in the advertisement section from posting his server more than once. Sure it gets locked eventually but a lot of “server browsers” don’t realize this as they are searching for a server not looking out for the forums. Due to this some servers will have the “unfair advantage”.

For reference of original discrepancy:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic
